snippet: Federal prosecutors said Friday that 10 more people would be charged in a fraud scheme involving hundred of workers, some of whom collected extra benefits after falsely claiming to have disabling injuries.
abstract: Federal prosecutors announce that about 10 more people will be charged in fraud scheme involving hundreds of Long Island Rail Road workers, some of whom collected extra disability retirement benefits after falsely claiming to have serious injuries; prosecutors emphasize that investigation is ongoing and that a large number of retired LIRR workers are under scrutiny. (M)
lead_paragraph: A prosecutor said on Friday that about 10 more people would be charged in what the government has called a huge fraud scheme involving hundreds of Long Island Rail Road workers, some of whom collected extra benefits each year after falsely claiming to have disabling injuries while retiring to lives of vigorous activity, including golf, tennis, aerobics and biking. A federal prosecutor emphasized that the investigation was continuing and stressed that a large number of retired railroad workers were being investigated.

headline.main: More Long Island Rail Road Retirees Are to Face Fraud Charges
